info.title: Medium API (Unofficial)
info.description:
Medium API (Unofficial) helps you to quickly fetch data from Medium's Website (https://medium.com). 

You can gather data related to users, publications, articles (including its textual content), latest posts & top writers within a topic/niche, etc…

get.description:
**Test Endpoint**
Returns the information about the Unofficial Medium API

developer.description: Full name of the API's developer

website.description: Link to the Medium API's website

get.description:
Returns the unique `user_id` for the given `username`.

**Note:** You can find the `username` from the user's/author's profile page URL. 
- **username**.medium.com
- medium.com/@**username**

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: It's a unique string chosen by every single Medium user.

id.description: Unique hash id of the user.

get.description:
Returns user-related information such as their

- Username
- Full name
- Bio
- Tier (FREE, MEMBER or FRIEND)
- Followers count
- Following count
- Publication Following count
- Twitter Username
- Profile Image URL
- Background Image URL
- Logo Image URL
- Tipping Link
- List of tags in which the user is Top Writer
- When did the user become a Medium Member (conditional)
- When did the user become "Friend of Medium" (conditional)
- Whether the user has Lists (boolean)
- Whether the user is a Medium-verified book author (boolean)
- Whether the user is enrolled in Medium Partner Program (boolean)
- Whether the user has allowed notes on their articles (boolean)
- Whether the user is suspended or not (boolean)

**Note:** If you don't know the `user_id`, you can get it from the _Get User ID_ endpoint (`/user/id_for/{username}`).

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: It's a unique hash id assigned to every single Medium user.

username.description: An unique name chosen by every single Medium user.

bio.description: A short description about the user.
bio.example: Obsessed with Tech Biz Arts & Words; Does NOT dumb down the writing; Skilled Wordsmith; Delivers the best

tier.description: Tier of the user. It can be FREE, MEMBER or FRIEND.

top_writer_in.description: List of tags in which the user is a Top Writer.

followers_count.description: Number of followers the user has.

following_count.description: Number of authors the user is following.

publication_following_count.description: Number of publications the user is following.

is_writer_program_enrolled.description: Whether the user is enrolled in the Medium Partner Program.

is_suspended.description: Whether the user is suspended or not.

has_list.description: Whether the user has created Lists.

is_book_author.description: Whether the user is a Medium-verified book author.

allow_notes.description: Whether the user has allowed notes on their articles.

medium_member_at.description: Date when the user became a Medium Member.

friend_since.description: Date when the user became "Friend of Medium".

tipping_link.description: A link where you can tip the Medium author.

get.description:
Returns a list of `article_ids` written by a specified user,  with a maximum of 250 `article_ids` per request. 

If the user has published over 250 articles, use the `next` query string  parameter in subsequent API calls to retrieve additional articles.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Unique hash id assigned to every single Medium user.

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Use this parameter to get more results on the next page.

associated_articles.description: List of article IDs associated with the user.

total_pinned_articles.description: Total number of articles pinned by the user.

next.description: Use this parameter to get more results on the next page.

get.description: Returns a list of `article_ids` of the top 10 articles on the user's profile, for a given `user_id`.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Unique hash id assigned to every single Medium user.

top_articles.description: List of top 10 articles on the user's profile.

total_pinned_articles.description: Number of articles pinned by the user.

get.description:
Returns the list of `user_ids` of the user's followers.

**Note:** When you get the response from the API, it will include an attribute called `next`.  You can use this next attribute as query string parameter (`after`) when you make your next API request.  This way, you can get the followers that come after the one you're currently looking at.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Unique hash id assigned to every single Medium user.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: To limit the number of results. (count <= 25)

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: To get the results after a particular follower's user id.

next.description: Use this parameter to get more results on the next page.

get.description:
Returns a list of users (`user_ids`) that the given user is following.

- Upto 500 results per request.
- To fetch additional results, use "next" query parameter provided in the previous response.

**Note:** This list does not contain the `publication_ids` of the publications that the user is following. To get those, please use _Get User Publication Following_ endpoint (`/user/{user_id}/publication_following`).

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Unique hash id assigned to every single Medium user.

parameters.name: next
parameters.description:
- The `next` parameter is used to paginate through the results.
- It should be set to the value of the `next` field from the previous response.
- If you want to get the first page, you can set it to an empty string.
- The `next` parameter is optional.
- If you don't provide it, the API will return the first page of results.

following.description: List of authors (User IDs) that the given user is following.

count.description: Number of user accounts that the given user is following.

next.description:
- This attribute can be used in your next request to get the next page of results.
- If there are no more results, this attribute will be an empty string.

get.description: Returns a list of publications (`publication_ids`) that the given user is following.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Unique hash id assigned to every single Medium user.

publication_following.description: List of Publications (IDs) that the given user is following.

get.description: Returns a list of tags that the given user follows.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Unique hash id assigned to every single Medium user.

tags_followed.description: An array of tags that the user follows.

get.description:
Returns an array of `list_ids` created by the user.

**Note:** You can check whether the user has created lists or not beforehand. Check the  `has_list` attribute in the "Article Info" endpoint.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Unique hash id assigned to every single Medium user.

lists.description: An array of Medium Lists (IDs) created by the user.

get.description: Returns 2 lists of `publication_ids` where the given user is either an admin (creator/editor) or a contributing writer.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Unique hash id assigned to every single Medium user.

admin_in.description: List of Publications (IDs) where the user is an admin (creator or editor).

writer_in.description: List of Publications (IDs) where the user is a contributing writer.

get.description:
Returns a list of all the books published by the user.  It includes book's title, description, co-authors, published date, cover image and URL.

**Note:** If you don't know the `user_id`, you can get it from the _Get User ID_ endpoint (`/user/id_for/{username}`).

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: It's a unique hash id assigned to every single Medium user.

books.description: List of books published by the user.

example.name: What did Tashi do?
example.description: A cybercrime thriller depicting the impact of leaked personal information on a woman's life.

example.name: Stolen Reflections: Some Stories Are Told in Verse
example.description: The love story of a modern young woman told through poems.

get.description:
Returns article-related information such as 
- Title
- Subtitle
- Author (ID)
- Tags
- Topics (assigned by Medium)
- Publication (ID)
- Published date and time
- Last Modified date and time
- Boosted date and time
- Clap Count
- Voter Count
- Word Count
- Views
- Reads
- Response Count
- Reading Time
- Language
- Unique Slug
- URL
- Image URL (Cover image)
- Top Highlight
- Whether the article is in a series or not (boolean)
- Whether the article is a shortform or not (boolean)
- Whether the article is locked or not (boolean)

parameters.name: article_id
parameters.description: It's a unique hash id assigned to every Medium Article.

title.example: Why it's Super Hard to be an ML Researcher or Developer?

subtitle.example: A Realization that Literally Changed my Life

responses_count.description: Number of responses/comments on the article.

word_count.description: Number of words in the article.

topics.description: List of topics assigned by Medium.

tags.description: List of tags assigned by the author.

claps.description: Number of claps on the article.

voters.description: Number of people who clapped on the article.

views.description: Number of views on the article.

reads.description: Number of reads on the article.

is_series.description: Whether the article is part of a series or not.

is_shortform.description: Whether the article is a shortform or not.

is_locked.description: Whether the article is locked or not.

published_at.description: Date and time when the article was published.

last_modified_at.description: Date and time when the article was last modified.

boosted_at.description: Date and time when the article was Boosted.

unique_slug.description: Unique slug assigned to the article.

image_url.description: URL of the cover image of the article.

top_highlight.example: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe - Abraham Lincoln"

get.description: Returns the content of an article for the given `article_id`.

parameters.name: article_id
parameters.description: It's a unique hash id assigned to every Medium Article.

content.example:
Article title
Article Subtitle
Article Content ....

get.description: Returns the markdown of a Medium Article/Story, for the given `article_id`

parameters.name: article_id
parameters.description: It's a unique hash id assigned to every Medium Article.

markdown.example:
# Article title
## Article Subtitle
Article **Content** with lot of _markups_ ....
![Images Alt](Image URL)

get.description:
Returns the **plain HTML** of a Medium Article, for the given `article_id`.

**Note:** This plain HTML output can be stylized as per your own custom branding. For the sample CSS, visit: https://mediumapi.com/styles/dark.css

parameters.name: article_id
parameters.description: It's a unique hash id assigned to every Medium Article.

parameters.name: fullpage
parameters.description: If 'true', returns full HTML page with head, body, title and meta tags. Else, returns HTML inside body only.

parameters.name: style_file
parameters.description: Name or link to a CSS file to be included in the HTML. It works when `fullpage` is true.

html.example:
Article Title

This is a paragraph

get.description:
Returns a list of URLs for the assets present in the Medium Article.

These assets may include images, embedded YouTube videos, Github Gists, Hyperlinks (anchors), Links to other Medium Articles, etc…

parameters.name: article_id
parameters.description: It's a unique hash id assigned to every Medium Article.

description.example: Mathematics of Music - "Twinkle Twinkle Little Star" Synthesized using Python (Numpy and Scipy) Full article at my profile: https://medium.com/@nishu_jain

get.description:
Returns a list of responses (`response_ids`, same as `article_ids`) for a given article (`article_id`)

**Note:** To see the content of the response, use the _Get Article's Content_ endpoint (`/article/{article_id}/content`)

parameters.name: article_id
parameters.description: It's a unique hash id assigned to every Medium Article.

responses.description: List of Response IDs associated with the article. Responses are also known as Comments.

get.description: Returns a list of `user_ids` of the people who clapped on the article (a.k.a `voters`).

parameters.name: article_id
parameters.description: It's a unique hash id assigned to every Medium Article.

voters.description: List of user IDs who clapped on the article. Also known as `voters` or `fans`.

get.description: Returns a list of 10 articles (`article_ids`) as recommended by the Medium, for the given article.

parameters.name: article_id
parameters.description: It's a unique hash id assigned to every Medium Article.

items.description: An array of Article IDs recommended by Medium for the given article.

get.description: Returns a list of `article_ids` of the related posts. (Length = 4)

parameters.name: article_id
parameters.description: It's a unique hash id assigned to every Medium Article.

items.description: An array of Articles (IDs) related to the given article.

get.description:
Returns the unique `publication_id` for the given `publication_slug`.

**Note:** You can find the `publication_slug` from the publication's homepage URL.
- medium.com/**publication_slug**

parameters.name: publication_slug
parameters.description: It's a lowercased hyphen-separated unique string alloted to each Medium Publication.

publication_id.description: Unique hash id of the publication.

publication_slug.description: Same publication slug that you passed in the path parameters.

get.description:
Returns the publication related information such as *Publication name, Tagline, Description, Tags, Followers Count, Twitter username, Instagram username, Facebook Page name, etc …*

**Note:** If you don't know the `publication_id`, you can get it from any article published by it. Use endpoint "/article/{article_id}" to retrieve the `publication_id`.

parameters.name: publication_id
parameters.description: It's a unique hash id assigned to every Medium Publication.

tagline.example: The World's Leading AI and Technology Publication

description.example: Towards AI is the world's leading AI and technology publication. Publishing unbiased AI and technology-related articles. Read by thought-leaders and decision-makers around the world.

followers.description: Number of followers of the publication.

facebook_pagename.description: Facebook Page name of the publication.

editors.description: List of Editors (ids) of the publication.

get.description: Returns the list of `articles_ids`, of the latest 25 articles, posted in that publication.

parameters.name: publication_id
parameters.description: It's a unique hash id assigned to every Medium Publication.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: To get the articles before specified date and time.

items.description: List of Articles (ids) published within the publication.

from.description: Date and time before which the articles are fetched.

to.description: Date and time after which the articles are fetched.

get.description:
Returns the newsletter related information such as *id, name, description, slug, creator_id, subscribers, image_url, etc …*

**Note:** If you don't know the `publication_id`, you can get it from any article published by it. Use endpoint "/article/{article_id}" to retrieve the `publication_id`.

parameters.name: publication_id
parameters.description: It's a unique hash id assigned to every Medium Publication.

name.example: This AI newsletter is all you need

description.example: We have moved our newsletter. Subscribe → https://ws.towardsai.net/subscribe

subscribers.description: Number of subscribers of the newsletter.

get.description:
Returns a list of recommended articles (`article_ids`) for the given `tag`.  This feed is similar to Topfeeds Trending Articles.

Using the `page` query string parameter, you can get the list page by page.  The page number can be between 1 and 20. Each page will have up to 25 Article IDs.

So at maximum, you can fetch 500 `article_ids` in 20 API calls.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: It's a unique string, usually hyphen-separated, representing a class of content.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A number between 1 and 20.

tag.description: Tag for which the articles are fetched.

get.description: Returns a list of `article_ids` (length: 25) for the given `tag` and `mode`.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: It's a unique string, usually hyphen-separated, representing a class of content.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description:
Mode:

  - `hot` : For getting trending articles
  - `new` : For getting latest articles
  - `top_year` : For getting best articles of the year
  - `top_month` : For getting best articles of the month
  - `top_week` : For getting best articles of the week
  - `top_all_time`: For getting best article of all time

tag.description: Tag for which the articles are fetched.

mode.description: Mode for which the articles are fetched.

get.description:
Returns a list of top writers (`user_ids`) within a particular topic/niche (`topic_slug`). 
e.g. 
- blockchain
- relationships
- artificial-intelligence, etc ...

**Note:** You can use optional `count` query parameter to limit the number of results.  The maximum number of top writers within a topic/niche will be 250.

parameters.name: topic_slug
parameters.description: It's a unique string, usually hyphen-separated, representing a topic/niche, as classified by Medium.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Limits the number of `article_ids` in the result.

get.description:
Returns a list of latest posts (`article_ids`) for a topic/niche (as classified by the Medium platform). Example of a topic/niche can be:
* blockchain
* relationships
* mental-health, etc …

These are known as `topic_slugs`. At any given moment, this endpoint will return a list of 25 articles (`article_ids`).

parameters.name: topic_slug
parameters.description: It's a unique string, usually hyphen-separated, representing a topic/niche, as classified by Medium.

get.description: Returns a list of `related_tags` for the given `tag`.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: It's a unique string, usually hyphen-separated, representing a class of content.

get.description:
Returns tag-related information.
- Name
- Followers Count
- Number of stories
- Number of writers
- Number of latest stories
- Number of latest writers
- Child tags (if any)

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: It's a unique string, usually hyphen-separated, representing a class of content.

get.description:
Returns a list of root tags (or top-level tags) from the Medium Platform.  This is how Medium broadly categorizes articles. 

These tags have their own child tags that you can fetch using the "Tag Info" endpoint. 

This list may change/expand in the future.

Returns a list of archived articles (max length = 20) for the given tag.  You can filter the results by adding optional parameters like `year` and `month`.  Use the `next` parameter to get more results.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: It's a unique string, usually hyphen-separated, representing a class of content.

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: Year of the archived articles (YYYY)

parameters.name: month
parameters.description: Month of the archived articles (MM)

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Use this parameter to get more results on the next page.

tag.description: Tag for which the articles are fetched.

next.description: Use this parameter to get more results on the next page.

get.description:
Returns a list of recommended users (who to follow) for the given tag. 

Max length = 250.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: It's a unique string, usually hyphen-separated, representing a class of content.

tag.description: Tag for which the users are recommended

get.description: Returns the list-related information such as *id, name, author, description,  thumbnail image url, creation datetime, last article inserted datetime,  number of articles in the list, claps, voters, and comments/responses*.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: It's a unique hash id assigned to every Medium List.

description.example: Collections of all the articles and resources related to Medium API

count.description: Number of articles in the list

responses_count.description: Number of comments/responses on the list

claps.description: Number of claps on the list

voters.description: Number of people who clapped on the list

created_at.description: Creation date and time of the list

last_item_inserted_at.description: Last article inserted date and time

get.description: Returns an array of `articles_ids` present in the given Medium List.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: It's a unique hash id assigned to every Medium List.

list_articles.description: An array of Article IDs present in the Medium List.

get.description: Returns an array of `response_ids` of the comments (same as `article_ids`) on the given Medium List.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: It's a unique hash id assigned to every Medium List.

responses.description: An array of Response/Comments (ids) on the Medium List.

get.description: Returns a list of `user_ids` for the given search query results. (Max Length = 1000)

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query

users.description: An array of Medium Users (IDs) for the given search query.

get.description: Returns the list of `publication_ids` for the given search query results. (Max Length = 1000)

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query

publications.description: An array of Medium Publications (IDs) for the given search query.

get.description: Returns the list of `articles_ids` for the given search query results. (Max Length = 1000)

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query

articles.description: An array of Medium Articles (IDs) for the given search query.

get.description: Returns a list of `tags` for the given search query results. (Max Length = 1000)

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query

items.description: An array of Medium Tags for the given search query.

get.description: Returns an array of `list_ids` for the given search query results. (Max Length = 1000)

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query

lists.description: An array of Medium Lists (IDs) for the given search query.
